entry.title: Birubala Rabha (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Indian activist Birubala Rabha (pictured) has rescued more than thirty women from being persecuted as witches in the last decade?

entry.title: Alchymic Quartet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Alchymic Quartet is a string quartet by Graham Waterhouse, to be performed alongside chemical experiments of Andrew Szydlo, his former teacher at Highgate School?

entry.title: 1913 El Paso smelters' strike (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the 1913 El Paso smelters' strike the Industrial Workers of the World and the Western Federation of Miners competed to organize the strikers with their respective labor unions?

entry.title: Lewes Road (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Lewes Road in Brighton has a gyratory named after a pornographic cinema?

entry.title: The Firebird (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1919 suite of The Firebird contained "more than three hundred errors"?

entry.title: 1923 killing of a black employee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that British outrage at the sentencing of a white Kenyan settler to just two years' imprisonment for the 1923 killing of a black employee eventually led to the replacement of the colony's legal code?

entry.title: Avi Kwa Ame National Monument (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Avi Kwa Ame National Monument, protected as a national monument since March 21, is a significant habitat of Joshua trees and threatened desert tortoises?

entry.title: Jen Zee (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the game designer of the video game Hades said that the characters were attractive "because Jen Zee"?
